grid module¶

class grid.BasicGrid(list_of_attributes_ranges, hypercubes_number, threshold)¶

Bases: grid.Grid

A representation of attributes space, to be divided into hypercubes. It applies only to the finest level.

Parameters:
  • list_of_attributes_ranges – A list of ranges of the attributes.
  • hypercubes_number – Number of Hypercubes in the finest level grid.
  • threshold – When the difference between cardinalities of the two most frequent classes divided by their sum is greater than the threshold, we assign the most frequent class.
Example:

list_of_attributes_ranges = [[0.0, 100.0], [5.9, 2030.0], [150.0, 220.0]] - It has three attributes (three dimensions).
add_example_to_grid(example)¶

Adds provided Example to the correct Hypercube in BasicGrid

Parameters:example – Example to be added to the grid.
batch_update(examples)¶

Updates the grid, given the batch_size of Examples. It groups Examples by class_id and by Hypercubes containing these Examples. If the Grid has a child, it is also forced to update itself.

Parameters:examples – A list of Examples to be used to update the BasicGrid.
compute_centers_of_hypercubes()¶

Computes every hypercube’s center by taking the midpoint between the beginning and the end of hypercube in every dimension.

set_hypercubes_classes()¶

Sets classes for all hypercubes in self and in its child (LowerLevelGrid).

test(example_coords)¶

Predicts the class of an observation with given coordinates.

Parameters:example_coords – A list of coordinates of an observation.
Returns:returned_class: Class predicted by the classifier.
update(example, hypercubes_coords=None)¶

Updates the grid with a given Example. If the Grid has a child, it is also forced to update itself with the new observation.

Parameters:
  • example – Example object to be used to update the BasicGrid.
  • hypercubes_coords – None in BasicGrid.
class grid.Grid(hypercubes_number, dims, level=None)¶

Bases: object

create_grids_structure()¶

Creates Hypercube objects for every index in the multidimensional self.hypercubes list.

create_lower_level_grid()¶

Creates LowerLevelGrid when it is possible - level equal to one means that this is the coarsest level.

nearest_neighbours_class(example_coords, parents_indices)¶

Given an Example, finds the class of its nearest nonempty Hypercube. First, it gathers the data (center coordinates and the class) of each parent Hypercube which coordinates are listed in parents_indices. Then it returns the class of the nearest nonempty parent Hypercube.

Parameters:
  • example_coords – Coordinates of the observation.
  • parents_indices – Indices of 2**dims Hypercubes, contained in current grids Hypercube.
Returns:

class of the nearest, not empty Hypercube
set_hypercubes_classes()¶
threshold¶

When difference between the cardinalities of two most frequent classes divided by their sum is greater than the threshold, we assign the most frequent class.

Setter:Sets the threshold for the grid.
Type:float
update(example, hypercubes_coords)¶
class grid.LowerLevelGrid(level, parent_hypercubes_number, parent_hypercubes, dims)¶

Bases: grid.Grid

A representation of attributes’ space to be divided into hypercubes.

Parameters:
  • level – Number from range between the BasicGrid.level and 1. The higher the number, the finer the Grid.
  • parent_hypercubes_number – Number of parent’s hypercubes.
  • parent_hypercubes – Finer level grid’s hypercubes.
  • dims – Number of attributes (of dimensions).
batch_update(parents_classes_dict)¶

Updates the grid. If grid has a child, it is also forced to update itself.

Parameters:parents_classes_dict – Keys: (class_id, hypercube_coords). Values: lists of Example objects.
classify(example_coords, hypercubes_coords)¶

Classifies observation with given coordinates.

Parameters:
  • example_coords – Coordinates of observation to be classified.
  • hypercubes_coords – Coordinates of Hypercube, which contained the observation on finer level.
compute_centers_of_hypercubes()¶

Computes every hypercube’s center by taking the midpoint between the beginning and the end of hypercube in every dimension.

set_hypercubes_classes()¶

Sets classes for all hypercubes in self and in it’s child (another LowerLevelGrid) if it exists.

set_hypercubes_parents_indices()¶

Computes coordinates of 2**dims parents’ Hypercubes for every Hypercube in the grid. Each coarser Hypercube consists of 2**dims finer level Hypercubes.

update(example, hypercubes_coords)¶

Updates the grid with given Example and then forces child_grid (if it exists) to update itself with this Example.

Parameters:
  • example – Example object to be used to update LowerLevelGrid.
  • hypercubes_coords – Coordinates of Hypercube, which contained the Example on finer level.
